text: Sunderlandwick is a hamlet in the East Riding of Yorkshire, England. It is situated approximately south of Driffield and lies to the west of the A164 road. It forms part of the civil parish of Hutton Cranswick. Sunderlandwick House and its associated stables was designated a Grade II listed building on 15 July 1998. Driffield Golf Club is actually in Sunderlandwick despite the name. Drive to Sunderlandwick House ( 53°59'6.23"N 0°26'58.08"W ). The house was built in 1962–63 for Sir Thomas Ferens on the site of an earlier Georgian house, Sunderlandwick Hall, altered in 1840s and burnt down on VJ Day, 1945. ==References== * ==External links== * Category:Villages in the East Riding of Yorkshire
title: Sunderlandwick
